definition: advantageous/favorable/to benefit at others' expense/to take unfair advantage
variant of 占[zhan4]
plain/informal/suitable/convenient/opportune/to urinate or defecate/equivalent to 就[jiu4]: then/in that case/even if/soon afterwards
see 便宜|便宜[pian2 yi5]
proper/should/suitable/appropriate
surname Yi

sentences.english: It would be an imposition on his good nature.
sentences.chinese: 這在他的善良本性上是一次佔便宜。

sentences.english: The nun wished to burn incense before her golden Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 尼姑想給她的金佛燒香，又不願意讓別的佛像佔便宜。

sentences.english: If you break faith and try to take advantage, I'll find someone else to work with.
sentences.chinese: 若你背信或相佔便宜，我就會找別人。

sentences.english: You won't be hornswoggled if you don't want to gain extra advantage.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不想佔便宜，你就受不了騙。

sentences.english: Is China Freeloading Off The U. S. Military's Work In Afghanistan And Iraq?
sentences.chinese: 美國軍隊在阿富汗和伊拉克工作，中國卻只佔便宜嗎？

sentences.english: and if they want to sort of free ride on my work, that's their business
sentences.chinese: 如果他們想從我的工作中佔便宜，那是他們的事。

sentences.english: Please trust a man who looked at choosing the perfect bridal gown before hand.
sentences.chinese: 請相信一個人看着選擇合適的婚紗禮服佔便宜。

sentences.english: Do the wealthy have a head start?

definition: to suffer losses/to come to grief/to lose out/to get the worst of it/to be at a disadvantage/unfortunately
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to show off/to try to be brave
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to threaten/to blackmail
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
double standard
to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
meddling in other people's business
idle gossip
to make thoughtless remarks (idiom)/to criticize/gossip
to counter every move/to be full of tricks
mortal wound/(fig.) fatal weakness/Achilles' heel
to keep the peace; to patch up a quarrel (idiom)
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
